intro: Coccoloba peltigera, commonly known as the rock nettle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland areas with well-drained conditions. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is often found in regions of the southeastern United States and the Caribbean. The plant is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray, making it a hardy species in coastal environments.
